title: Assassin: Do you feel outplayed?
body:
Assassins are supposed to be about outplaying their opponents and catching them off guard ultimately killing their target. However in LOL it never feels that way. Assassins just seem to come at you and do so much damage you just die. Their outplay potential is supposed to be tied to creative uses of their mobility but often its just used to come at you head on or run away. And in the case of zed and leblanc they do both at the same time.

People say that assassins fall off but I disagree. The longer the game goes on the more valuable picking off a person is and who is better at doing that than assassins. Now I'm not saying lets nerf the class across the board or anything like that. But I think its time to think about what is fair for an assassin and their target. Sion for example is loaded with cc but theres tons of counterplay to that. Assassins are load with damage and mobility and unfortunately the counterplay seems to be don't be near them or be tanky enough to survive.

Thoughts?

replies.body: I mean i guess, but i feel as if tank champs do that more, like darius, garen, volibear, etc.
Those champs also have a harder time catching up to a target and sticking to one. They also aren't known to 100 to 0 someone in 2 seconds.
Tank Ekko, tank Fizz....
Those are assassins building tank. Blame their design for allowing it to be effective.

But, at the same time, both have massive sticking power anyways. So really all they do is hop/roll/dash/blink/do whatever around your backlines. Fizz, though, doesn't deserve to be gutted. Ekko too. They just need some more changes. Or maybe tank meta op?

They need their %HP damage removed. The only champions that prove to be legitimate problems building sunfire+IBG are champions with %HP damage. 

Tank Akali is a farce that only works if she gets a massive lead early. Same with Talon. 

All of the other meta 'tanks' atm are fighters/assassins with %HP damage. Not true tanks. 

Maokai is the only exception, and guess what he has. %HP damage. Guess which other champions are constantly either dominating or 'useless' in any meta.  Shyv/Mundo. Who both have %HP damage.

Another thing that causes some assassins to work effectively as bruisers (effectively what most "tank" builds for assassins are) is the ability to deal damage over time.

Low cooldown abilities plus abilities that can be applied again and again along with sticking power means you don't need much if any damage built in order to whittle down your opponent.
IMO, assassins should never have a low CD ability. They should be one shot wonders if they ever hope to be a balanced concept that even comes close to resembling the current archetype in LoL.

Personally, if it has a low cooldown, it should have next to no base damage.  Give it a semi-Nasus treatment.  You actually have to build damage stats and build up your ability before it actually begins to really hurt.  Obviously you want it to cap though.

IMO, if it has a low CD, have its damage scale with champion level. That way its not too out-of-control if they get a lead (snowballing assassins always get a massive gold lead compared to experience).

It also allows them to level another ability if they end up behind in experience, while still retaining palatable damage on their spammable ability. 

This makes them less feast or famine (at least for experienced players) on both ends.

>darius, garen, volibear, etc.

Garen and Darius aren't tanks...?
Right my bad. They just build full tank items.
Tanks dont build cleaver, maw, steraks....
Neither do garen or darius lol. They build cleaver and then tank items after that.
Then guess whos not a tank? Garen and Darius.
I think the word you guys are looking for is Bruiser.
For those two, it's "juggernaut."
True, though juggernauts are really just a subset of bruiser.
I don't think the general populace is ever going to adapt to this idea.

{{champion:238}} 

Not trying to start a Zed hate post, but I just want to say that I don't feel very outplayed when he hits me with his ult.  Short of going untargetable, there is no way to avoid his dive with the ult and whenever I play tanks (like Sion, which I do a lot) I feel pretty frustrated when there is literally nothing I can do to save my carry from his ult.  Except when I'm playing {{champion:223}}.

That's the only thing that bugs me about Zed.  His ult doesn't feel like an outplay potential ability.  It's just an execute with an escape mechanic and doesn't seem to have anything to punish.  

If that is what is meant to be healthy for an assassin, then I think assassins are not welcome in this game.

So Talon jumping on your ADC giving you no reaction time , instant killing them, feels more fair?

I'd rather be given the option to dodge skills and time to avoid the damage, unlike Talon with Zed you can actually avoid the damage.

Although not a popular opinion I think Zed is on the healthiest assassins in the game, he gives you reaction time (Delayed Execution and heavily telegraphed). And the option to dodge his Abilities since they are skill shots (most of his damage comes from the Q'S).

> [{quoted}](name=Guy Fox Teemo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ApT4rufg,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2016-06-07T02:19:20.467+0000)
>
> So Talon jumping on your ADC giving you no reaction time , instant killing them, feels more fair?
 
Never said it was.


> I'd rather be given the option to dodge skills and time to avoid the damage, unlike Talon with Zed you can actually avoid the damage.

Except his ult unless you have {{item:3157}} or some way to become untargetable.
> 
> Although not a popular opinion I think Zed is on the healthiest assassins in the game, he gives you reaction time (Delayed Execution and heavily telegraphed). And the option to dodge his Abilities since they are skill shots (most of his damage comes from the Q'S).

I really have to ask the point of a heavily telegraphed ability that is impossible to avoid outside of going untargetable.  Which isn't something easy to obtain.

Because I'd say Talon is a better example and the Zed is example seems to be based off more bias and false claims.

His ult is avoidable in a sense that is basically does no damage unless you landed the abilities and the got the combo off correctly, the 1 Zed auto damage that his ult does it more often then not; Not going to kill you unless you landed your abilities so yes in that sense, it is very easily avoidable, and if he did land abilities (which would be at your fault since you didn't dodge his Q's).

Then you can always Zhonyas, Barrier, heal, or use abilities that help you avoid damage, or take less damage, which there are **Plenty** of in the game. Not all champions can do so, but thats perfectly ok, Zed shouldn't be hard countered by every champion and not every champion should have  way to counter Zed.

> [{quoted}](name=Guy Fox Teemo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ApT4rufg,comment-id=0009000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-07T02:33:07.946+0000)
>
> not every champion should have  way to counter Zed.

I'm gonna have to disagree with you right there.  I feel that unless there is a reasonable way to counter something, then it just becomes frustrating and obnoxious to deal with.  If the counter isn't too hard for anyone to access, then it might even make the playerbase of what is being countered stronger, since they'd have to use their abilities more carefully. 

Course I'm of a different perspective.  But if you are correct, then I'll be sure to remember that whenever I hear a {{champion:238}} spam, "Skillz!" whenever he ults a low health enemy that doesn't have the items required.

Cause, you know, having to buy a particular item to counter one champion is perfectly fine.

I don't think there should be  a perfect counter for everything, some champions just out right lose to Zed and thats 100% okay. Some champions deal better against and some champions out right counter him as well.

Thats how this game works, if there was an absolute counter to everything in this game, it would be incredibly frustrating as every champion would have to be an unreliable feast or famine champion, since none of there abilities can be reliable since they all need counter play.

While there should be some degree of it for every champion (Zed I'd argue has some of the most counterplay for any champion, at least of his class). Not all champions should have a reliable way, Zed has a good match ups and bad match ups, but most people like to look at it from a biased perspective and just say "WELL HE'S OP AS SHIT AND WINS EVERYTHING HUR DER 100% WIN RATE".



Also you don't need to buy Zhonyas to counter Zed, its an option and that almost complete nulls him out of kills, I don't even think that should be an option, I think it should be removed and the mage class should get smaller items that do less, but more of them. I'd argue this is in *FAVOR* of mages because they have such a good option, while Zed has Maw, that doesn't completely null a mage like some would suggest.
What are Zed's bad match ups?

All of his 50/50 match-ups are his 'bad match-ups'.

 :^)

Yeah Zed has all the tools to defeat or nullify his ''counters''. That have never been real counterpicks, because at most most of them dont die or force him to farm undertower (which is lol for Zed, thank for the free farm).

The only real counter to Zed were Urgot and Malzahar, but Urgod was gutted and Malzahar no longer can CC burst a Zed's all in.

>The only real counter to Zed were Urgot and Malzahar, but Urgod was gutted and Malzahar no longer can CC burst a Zed's all in.

I would point out {{champion:8}} and {{champion:50}} are both decent match ups against him.  Otherwise I'd pick a bruiser into mid.
Lovely how the best way to counter him is by sending a non-mid laner mid.

Assasins have been an anti fun class in many a multiplayer game.

Zed despite his oppresive lane phase can be countered by items qss/zhonyais ect.

The likes of talon and rengar (remember the oneshots) cannot be counter played nor counter built
I thought QSS no longer works against him. O.o

> [{quoted}](name=SylvanasWrunner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ApT4rufg,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2016-06-07T01:23:04.980+0000)
>
> I thought QSS no longer works against him. O.o

It don't.
Sorry been away for a while had no idea they changed it, surely mikaels removes it still?

Nope, does not. Only thing you can do is zonyas with its 120 sec cooldown so he just waits for his ult to finish its much lower CD to kill you again, if he didnt just sit on your stasis gold body to finish you off anyway. Or get a Guardian Angel and let him kill you. 

And as a Talon main im gonna call bs on cant be countered. Like any assasin easiest counter is dont be alone. I can dominate, and usually do the laning phase, but once the enemy goes everywhere in groups of 3-5 i cant go in because even if I get my kill im most likely going to die and get 1 kill to the enemys 1 kill +2-4 assist.

I feel outplayed by assassins when they successfully flank me, catch me out of position, or show up in unexpected places.
I may be biased here, since I play a lot of Eve, but her and Shaco are usually the only ones who do that kind of thing.

Most of the others just wait until you come into their kill range, jump at you, and burst you down.  A lot of them also have so much built-in safety that they don't even put themselves at that much risk to do so, which makes it feel even less like an outplay.

I think eve is interesting in that she is all about surprising the enemy with her sudden appearance and her damage isn't all that high unless shes full ap. But if she is shes very all or nothing being that her only mobility is running faster and timing is important if they have a slow. However she probably is one of the first assassins to be built full tank but her utility is no where near other assassins to do so. Looking at you ekko.

As for shaco he does require some planning and has trade offs. His boxes need time to arm. He can q in for the stealth and damage but then he has no way out unless he thought ahead with box placement. And his ult has quite a few uses but isn't very powerful on its own.

I'd agree assassins are a bit too safe for what they are capable of and thats why I feel its important that there be proper tradeoffs for their mobility and damage.

One thing which is funny is that Eve has really poor damage for an assassin (worst in class by far, even if building full damage), but Ekko - who was specifically designed to be a skirmish-assassin with high utility/mobility and fairly low damage - out-damages her by a significant margin despite being much, much safer.

> [{quoted}](name=Nameless Voice,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ApT4rufg,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2016-06-07T01:07:14.311+0000)
>
> One thing which is funny is that Eve has really poor damage for an assassin (worst in class by far, even if building full damage), but Ekko - who was specifically designed to be a skirmish-assassin with high utility/mobility and fairly low damage - out-damages her by a significant margin despite being much, much safer.

The reason riot avoids eve like every time is because her passive is so problematic

> [{quoted}](name=Derpyon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ApT4rufg,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-07T05:04:28.057+0000)
>
> The reason riot avoids eve like every time is because her passive is so problematic

I wouldn't say it's because it's problematic(it definitely is, but riot often takes a "go fuck yourself" approach to problematic mechanics, and bottom line is that eve is still a strong champion), as much that it's insanely strong and requires big tradeoffs to not make her broken.

Yeah, it's a bit odd, but it's more of "How we thought about the game then and now." Nowadays, Champions are imbued with a whole lot more mechanics to make them mobile, safe, or threatening (In, as everyone knows, Ekko's case, it's all 3). Back when Evelynn was made, though, the "assassin" class was far more based around sneaking up and killing someone from surprise, not "outplaying" your opponent to kill them. (Which is why Eve and Shaco are two of the most consistently balanced assassins in the game-- they're simple, but effective. They do their job without being overly oppressive, but just annoying enough.)

With Evelynn, they have to keep her on a really tight leash ~~(she probably likes that anyways)~~ because of her passive, as previously stated. The problem is, even if they rework her, they _cannot, in any way, remove her current passive,_ because THAT is what defines Evelynn as a champion more than anything else. Not her hate spike spam, not her ult shield/slow, it's her passive. No other champion can be invisible as consistently as her, only Twitch coming in second place with his impressive stealth duration. So when it comes to changing her kit...

Q? It'll have to be pretty much the same due to her playstyle fantasy of "running along the enemy (no matter how fast) and constantly being able to attack them without stopping.)

W? Could change, but it's what allows her playstyle fantasy to work so well, her speed.

E? Could easily be changed.

R? Was thrown in to give her more survivability. Funnily enough, there's one other champion who has this ultimate on a normal ability-- Ekko. Except his is far stronger, at the cost of a delay. Ekko's _stuns_ all enemy champions hit if he goes in it, or _heavily slows_ them as long as they're inside of it. Evelynn's _slows_ all enemy champions hit when it comes out. There is no lingering field. Ekko's gives him a _massive shield_ (that's almost a second HP bar) _that scales with his AP._ Evelynn's gives her a fairly strong shield that scales with _each enemy you hit_ instead, making it FAR weaker in 1v1 situations, and only comparable when you hit 3 or more people at once with an AoE that's far smaller.

So what does Evelynn have that the infamous Ekko doesn't? Well, naturally, her invisibility. 1 for Evelynn. Second, would be her mobility. _Except,_ Ekko SLOWS her (which overrides all speed boosts) and _speeds himself up_ every 3 hits, slows her on a Q, OR slows/stuns her on a W. (If you have Rylai's, congrats! You slow her on every ability in your kit.) Even though Evelynn's W cleanses slows, it cannot come off cooldown fast enough to get through all of those. So there's 1 for Ekko. Damage? Ekko far beats her in that, even when building tank. 2 for Ekko. Survivability? ...Do you really need to ask? 3 for Ekko. 

So you've got Evelynn who has... stealth.

And Ekko who's got... everything else. 

This isn't really an Ekko hate post, just more of that he's the closest champion with similar mechanics that I could compare her to (aside from maybe Hecarim? But Hecarim is tankier than Eve+Stronger Teamfight Potential+More CC.) 

I personally think Riot's terrified of changing Eve because she might turn into a second Ekko. And honestly, to fit her in this season... she might need it.

> [{quoted}](name=Nameless Voice,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ApT4rufg,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-06-07T00:05:05.842+0000)
>
> I feel outplayed by assassins when they successfully flank me, catch me out of position, or show up in unexpected places.
> I may be biased here, since I play a lot of Eve, but her and Shaco are usually the only ones who do that kind of thing.
> 
> Most of the others just wait until you come into their kill range, jump at you, and burst you down.  A lot of them also have so much built-in safety that they don't even put themselves at that much risk to do so, which makes it feel even less like an outplay.

do you feel outplayed when an LB jumps on you in the middle of your team and kill you and the support with a dash in less than half a second?

I'm a Talon main, and as much as I get off on stabbing the ADC, mid laner and support before any of them realize their screens turned grayscale, even I hate LeBlanc with a passion.

Being of the opinion that assassins should have a risk factor that matches their damage, I can't stand high safety assassins. LeBlanc, Fizz and Zed are the undisputed pinnacle of this "high safety" class, with a dishonorable mention for "skirmisher" Yasuo.

I know when I'm beat; they'll drop a pink ward before/when the fight starts, or a tank sticks near the carry, because assassins like Talon, Kha'Zix and Katarina don't have a way out unless they kill someone. "High safety" assassins don't have this drawback, while retaining the damage that rivals "high risk".

The only saving grace is that lately, Zed has more options for counteracting his damage to make up for his low risk factor (even after the removal of QSS's Death Mark denial), but for no good reason he's the only one, and it doesn't solve the problem with Zed's kit at its core.

That was literally his point.

He feels outplayed when assassins actually outplay, not just have a death area around them.
Just play fizz tbh

> [{quoted}](name=Defended,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ApT4rufg,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-06-07T00:11:08.967+0000)
>
> Just play fizz tbh

Pls no we don't need any more fizz players

Nocturne, my beloved assassin. I need vision to kill an ADC, i need to outplay them with my shield, i need to be 2 sec near them to fear them, and i need to hit with my Q else i lose 55 AD(though if they are feared it's easy).

And that's why I'd say he's the only fair/balanced assassin. Sure he gets a banshee's veil on command, but it lasts 0.5 seconds with a 20 second cooldown; meaning he has to be precise but can't use it as a 'get out of jail free' card in order to outplay his target, unlike several assassins and similarly played fighters being spammed.
why is this downvoted? 100% true. The shield has a short duration, long cooldown. And nocturne has only 1 dash on a long cooldown.
Apparently the modern generation can't accept fighting fair, nor capable of using their brains to outplay the enemy other than spamming a single button.
